UNITED TEAM NEWS FOR BURTON CUP TIE

Axel Tuanzebe is set to miss Manchester United's Carabao Cup tie with Burton Albion and Reds manager Jose Mourinho has revealed four players have been rested ahead of Wednesday's clash at Old Trafford.

Promising teenager Tuanzebe is out with a back problem, while David De Gea, Antonio Valencia, Eric Bailly and Nemanja Matic will be handed a night off.

"I gave two days off only to four players," revealed the boss. "Apart from that, everybody is selected. Do you want to know which four? De Gea, Valencia, Matic and Bailly."

When asked if he is taking the competition, which the Reds won last season with a 3-2 triumph over Southampton at Wembley, seriously, he replied: "Oh, yes. Serious. Because it's football, it's competition. We take it seriously.

"Of course, we're not playing David or Bailly but, if we go to the next round, probably these guys will play and I will give a rest to others. Our squad is good.

"We don't have 30 players, we have what we have, and a couple of injuries right now with Paul Pogba and Axel Tuanzebe. So we need some of the players that played on Sunday to play and we need some to be on the bench.

"We need to be with a strong team. I know the quality of the Championship and I know, if we don't take the game seriously, we are going to lose."

Tuanzebe, meanwhile, is hoping the injury does not keep him out for too long as he bids to impress the manager over the course of the campaign.

"I've been struggling with my back, but the rehab's going well and, behind the scenes, everyone is doing a good job," he told ManUtd.com.

Man Utd news: Cristiano Ronaldo wants Real Madrid to raid Red Devils for Angel Gomes

James Cambridge
PUBLISHED: 08:22, Wed, Sep 20, 2017
Cristiano RonaldoGETTY

Cristiano Ronaldo wants Angel Gomes at Real Madrid
CRISTIANO RONALDO has reportedly advised Real Madrid to sign Manchester United youngster Angel Gomes.

Angel Gomes is a product of the Manchester United academy and has already begun to make waves in the first team.

The 17-year-old forward was handed his debut by Jose Mourinho, replacing Wayne Rooney in a 2-0 win over Crystal Palace on the final day of last season.

He also scooped the club’s Young Player of the Year award in May and has caught the attention of Europe’s top clubs.

And Spanish outlet Don Balon claim Cristiano Ronaldo is determined to see him brought to Real Madrid.

Angel GomesGETTY

Angel Gomes is also reportedly a target for Barcelona
Advertisement

The report says Ronaldo sees Gomes as a long-term successor who can become a key figure at the Bernabeu in the future.

And he is also keen to ensure the teenager does not go to their rivals Barcelona, who are also showing interest.

The Sun claimed this week United are sweating over the future of Gomes who is yet to sign a professional deal.

He was reportedly set to sign his first contract on his 17th birthday last month but is yet to do so.

Advertisement

Barca are said to be circling and could sign him for a nominal fee next summer should he walk away from Old Trafford.

Gomes’ situation is reminiscent of Paul Pogba’s, who left the club in 2012 for Juventus, only to return four years later for £89million.

The Sun claim if Gomes is tempted to leave, the fee set by a tribunal next summer could be around £4m.

He has made four appearances this term in United’s youth ranks, scoring two goals and providing one assist and could be involved for tonight in the Carabao Cup against Burton.
